attributes.review: Today I was sitting at home wondering what it is I could do to get more information on the Trump 2020 campaign and support our beloved rapist president. I had already heard of his triumphs in killing off thousands of American citizens through gross negligence, tear gassing and shooting rubber bullets at protestors for a photo shoot, and putting children in cages; so I wanted to know more about his amazing achievements and his plans for keeping America great. As soon as I downloaded the app and attempted to open it however, it crashed. I attempted several more times to open the app and each time I would open up to black screen and would then be forced out of the app moments later. When I was finally able to get the app to open, I was shocked to discover I would need to provide my phone number in order to register for the app. I am very weary of providing that kind of personal information, but seeing as how there was no option to register without one, I hesitantly entered it in. Not even a few minutes after I registered, I received numerous calls from unknown numbers. I continued to block each number that came through, but the calls didn‚Äôt stop. I immediately deleted the app, fearing for my privacy. I‚Äôm not receiving text messages as well from unknown numbers in addition to the calls and it‚Äôs always from different numbers. I am trapped in a cycle of fear, blocking each phone call and text message I receive now. I even accidentally blocked a coworkers number who called me asking about shift coverage as the intensity of my paranoia grows. This app has ruined my life.
attributes.title: The worst app I‚Äôve ever had the misfortune of downloading

attributes.review: I downloaded this app so i could get the deets about all the rallies our great president cheeto was doing. So I downloaded this app and from first glance it looked suspicious. The format of the app looks outdated and is filled with inappropriate ads which blocked my screen the whole time!! It also asked for my phone number which I wouldnt know why they would want it üôÑ. The picture I saw when I first opened the app disturbed and offended me greatly and I think that picture is very offensive to people who are allergic to oranges. I dont understand why they would put that revolting picture as their background. I have read many reviews on this app and discovered that many others have had the same problems I encountered. Please delete this app to further offend others. Thank you.
attributes.title: TERRIBLE APP  üòæüòæ 1 STAR

attributes.review:
almost the entire bee movie script
According to all known laws of aviation, there is no way that a bee should be able to fly. Its wings are too small to get its fat little body off the ground. The bee, of course, flies anyway. Because bees don‚Äôt care what humans think is impossible.‚Äù SEQ. 75 - ‚ÄúINTRO TO BARRY‚Äù INT. BENSON HOUSE - DAY ANGLE ON: Sneakers on the ground. Camera PANS UP to reveal BARRY BENSON‚ÄôS BEDROOM ANGLE ON: Barry‚Äôs hand flipping through different sweaters in his closet. BARRY Yellow black, yellow black, yellow black, yellow black, yellow black, yellow black...oohh, black and yellow... ANGLE ON: Barry wearing the sweater he picked, looking in the mirror. BARRY (CONT‚ÄôD) Yeah, let‚Äôs shake it up a little. He picks the black and yellow one. He then goes to the sink, takes the top off a CONTAINER OF HONEY, and puts some honey into his hair. He squirts some in his mouth and gargles. Then he takes the lid off the bottle, and rolls some on like deodorant. CUT TO: INT. BENSON HOUSE KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS Barry‚Äôs mother, JANET BENSON, yells up at Barry. JANET BENSON Barry, breakfast is ready! CUT TO: "Bee Movie" - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 1. INT. BARRY‚ÄôS ROOM - CONTINUOUS BARRY Coming! SFX: Phone RINGING. Barry‚Äôs antennae vibrate as they RING like a phone. Barry‚Äôs hands are wet. He looks around for a towel. BARRY (CONT‚ÄôD) Hang on a second! He wipes his hands on his sweater, and pulls his antennae down to his ear and mouth. BARRY (CONT'D) Hello? His best friend, ADAM FLAYMAN, is on the other end. ADAM Barry? BARRY Adam? ADAM Can you believe this is happening? BARRY Can‚Äôt believe it. I‚Äôll pick you up. Barry sticks his stinger in a sharpener. SFX: BUZZING AS HIS STINGER IS SHARPENED. He tests the sharpness with his finger. SFX: Bing. BARRY (CONT‚ÄôD) Looking sharp. ANGLE ON: Barry hovering down the hall, sliding down the staircase bannister. Barry‚Äôs mother, JANET BENSON, is in the kitchen. JANET BENSON Barry, why don‚Äôt you use the stairs? Your father paid good money for those. "Bee Movie" - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 2. BARRY Sorry, I‚Äôm excited. Barry‚Äôs father, MARTIN BENSON, ENTERS. He‚Äôs reading a NEWSPAPER with the HEADLINE, ‚ÄúQueen gives birth to thousandtuplets: Resting Comfortably.‚Äù MARTIN BENSON Here‚Äôs the graduate. We‚Äôre very proud of you, Son. And a perfect report card, all B‚Äôs. JANET BENSON (mushing Barry‚Äôs hair) Very proud. BARRY Ma! I‚Äôve got a thing going here. Barry re-adjusts his hair, starts to leave. JANET BENSON You‚Äôve got some lint on your fuzz. She picks it off. BARRY Ow, that‚Äôs me! MARTIN BENSON Wave to us. We‚Äôll be in row 118,000. Barry zips off. BARRY Bye! JANET BENSON Barry, I told you, stop flying in the house! CUT TO: SEQ. 750 - DRIVING TO GRADUATION EXT. BEE SUBURB - MORNING A GARAGE DOOR OPENS. Barry drives out in his CAR. "Bee Movie" - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 3. ANGLE ON: Barry‚Äôs friend, ADAM FLAYMAN, standing by the curb. He‚Äôs reading a NEWSPAPER with the HEADLINE: ‚ÄúFrisbee Hits Hive: Internet Down. Bee-stander: ‚ÄúI heard a sound, and next thing I knew...wham-o!.‚Äù Barry drives up, stops in front of Adam. Adam jumps in. BARRY Hey, Adam. ADAM Hey, Barry. (pointing at Barry‚Äôs hair) Is that fuzz gel? BARRY A little. It‚Äôs a special day. Finally graduating. ADAM I never thought I‚Äôd make it. BARRY Yeah, three days of grade school, three days of high school. ADAM Those were so awkward. BARRY Three days of college. I‚Äôm glad I took off one day in the middle and just hitchhiked around the hive. ADAM You did come back different. They drive by a bee who‚Äôs jogging. ARTIE Hi Barry! BARRY (to a bee pedestrian) Hey Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good. Barry and Adam drive from the suburbs into the city. ADAM Hey, did you hear about Frankie? "Bee Movie" - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 4. BARRY Yeah. ADAM You going to his funeral? BARRY No, I‚Äôm not going to his funeral. Everybody knows you sting someone you die, you don‚Äôt waste it on a squirrel. He was such a hot head. ADAM Yeah, I guess he could‚Äôve just gotten out of the way. The DRIVE through a loop de loop. BARRY AND ADAM Whoa...Whooo...wheee!! ADAM I love this incorporating the amusement park right into our regular day. BARRY I guess that‚Äôs why they say we don‚Äôt need vacations. CUT TO: SEQ. 95 - GRADUATION EXT. GRADUATION CEREMONY - CONTINUOUS Barry and Adam come to a stop. They exit the car, and fly over the crowd to their seats. * BARRY * (re: graduation ceremony) * Boy, quite a bit of pomp...under * the circumstances. * They land in their seats. BARRY (CONT‚ÄôD) Well Adam, today we are men. "Bee Movie" - JS REVISIONS 8/13/07 5. ADAM We are. BARRY Bee-men. ADAM Amen! BARRY Hallelujah. Barry hits Adam‚Äôs forehead. Adam goes into the rapture. An announcement comes over the PA. ANNOUNCER (V.O) Students, faculty, distinguished bees...please welcome, Dean Buzzwell. ANGLE ON: DEAN BUZZWELL steps up to the podium. The podium has a sign that reads: ‚ÄúWelcome Graduating Class of:‚Äù, with train-station style flipping numbers after it. BUZZWELL Welcome New Hive City graduating class of... The numbers on the podium change to 9:15. BUZZWELL (CONT‚ÄôD) ...9:15. (he clears his throat) And that concludes our graduation ceremonies. And begins your career at Honex Industries. BARRY Are we going to pick our job today? ADAM I heard it‚Äôs just orientation. The rows of chairs change in transformer-like mechanical motion to Universal Studios type tour trams. Buzzwell walks off stage. BARRY (re: trams) Whoa, heads up! Here we go. "Bee Movie" - JS REVISIONS
